greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = binomial(2^n, n).
comment: a(n) is the number of n X n (0,1) matrices with distinct rows modulo rows permutations. - Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Nov 13 2003
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..60
formula: G.f.: A(x) = Sum_{n>=0} log(1 + 2^n*x)^n / n!. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 28 2007
program: (PARI) /* G.f. A(x) as Sum of Series: */ a(n)=polcoeff(sum(k=0,n,log(1+2^k*x +x*O(x^n))^k/k!),n) \\ _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 28 2007
(Sage) [binomial(2^n, n) for n in (0..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 14 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
